title: Srimad Bhagavatam | Sri Mahotsaha Chaitanya Dasa | SB 1.19.1 | 17.11.2024
speaker: HG Amitasana Dasa

segments.key_quote: A pious king regretted his accidental improper treatment of the powerful brahmana who was faultless.
segments.summary: The speaker begins by reading from Srimad Bhagavatam and discusses the importance of repentance for accidental sins committed by devotees.
segments.transcript: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 1, Chapter 19, Text No. 1 Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 1, Chapter 19, Text No. 1 Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 1, Chapter 19, Text No. 1 A pious king regretted his accidental improper treatment of the powerful brahmana who was faultless. Such repentance is natural for a good man like the king, and such repentance delivers a devotee from all kinds of sins accidentally committed. The devotees are naturally faultless. Accidental sins committed by a devotee are sincerely regretted and by the great Buddha. In the face of the Lord, all sins unwillingly committed by a devotee are burnt in the fire of repentance.

segments.key_quote: So the nature of Kali Yuga is, the Kali Yuga is even famous as the age of quarrel.
segments.summary: The speaker transitions to discussing current events, specifically a cricket tournament controversy, to illustrate the quarrelsome nature of Kali Yuga and how it manifests at various levels of society.
segments.transcript: So the last week, one of the important news has been that the next year in 2025, early 2025, there is going to be a world's cricket tournament, Champions Trophy, ICC Champions Trophy, which is supposed to be hosted by Pakistan and to be played in Pakistan. So India has raised objections that they don't want to send their team to Pakistan due to security reasons and also due to the tensions, political tension, which is existing between, prevailing between the two countries. And Pakistan is adamant, they want the tournament to happen there only and they are demanding. They are demanding ICC, that it should go on whether they come or don't come, whether India participates or not participates. But if India does not participate, then there will be a huge revenue loss because everyone, India is the most populated country in the world and has the most crazy cricket fans, everyone wants to watch Indian team. If India doesn't play, the viewership goes down. So ICC is in trouble. So why I am sharing this is because we can see there is this fight happening at an international level between nations. So the nature of Kali Yuga is, the Kali Yuga is even famous as the age of quarrel. So there exists fight at so many levels on Kali Yuga, between persons to persons, society. Society to society, community to community, and even nation, state to state. We also know how here, Kannada, we have to, Kannadigas want people to talk Kannada. Others don't want, they don't want to learn Kannada, so there is tension. And nation to nation, as we have seen here. And therefore, it is so difficult, for people to live together, even within a family, you know, or for friends, and for communities, to live together,

segments.key_quote: Yet, Srimad Bhagavatam, by its existence, exemplary devotees, narrations of the exemplary devotees, has given us practical demonstration of how we can live peacefully in this world, even in the current age of Kali, if we practice the principles mentioned in Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights ISKCON as an example of how people from diverse backgrounds can unite through Krishna consciousness and live peacefully despite the challenges of Kali Yuga.

segments.key_quote: The international society for Krishna consciousness has been organized for this purpose.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the purpose of ISKCON, citing a verse from Srimad Bhagavatam, emphasizing the importance of devotee association for understanding the Lord and His devotees.
segments.transcript: when Srila Prabhupada built a house in which the whole world can live. So Prabhupada in fact defines the purpose of starting ISKCON. Why did he start ISKCON? It is mentioned in Srimad Bhagavatam 4th Canto 12th Chapter 48. In the context of Drona Maharaj and Drona Maharaj's character and activities. In the end of that narration where Maitreya Rishi is narrating this. He says, Prabhupada says in the purport. It is said that only in the association of devotees can one understand the importance of the character. And pastimes of the supreme personality of Godhead or his devotees. It is especially recommended that Drona Maharaj's character be discussed in a society of the twice born. Which refers to the qualified Brahmanas, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas. One should especially seek the society of Brahmanas who are elevated to the position of Vaishnavas. Thus discussion. The discussion of Srimad Bhagavatam which describes the character and pastimes of devotees and the Lord is very quickly effective. Then Prabhupada states the purpose. The international society for Krishna consciousness has been organized for this purpose. What is that purpose? In every center of this society, not only in the morning, evening or noon. But practically 24 hours a day. There is continuous devotional service going on. Anyone who comes into contact with the society automatically becomes a devotee.

segments.key_quote: Anyone can join the international society for Krishna consciousness and be initiated to become twice born.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the opportunity for anyone to join ISKCON, become initiated, and be considered twice-born, emphasizing that advancement in devotional service is only possible in the association of devotees.
segments.transcript: We have actual experience that many Karmis and others come to the society. And find a very pleasing and peaceful atmosphere in the temples of ISKCON. In this verse. The word Dvijanmanam means one of the twice born. Anyone can join the international society for Krishna consciousness. And be initiated to become twice born. So Prabhupada opened up this opportunity for all of us. For anyone who agrees to practice the principles of Krishna consciousness. And be in the association of devotees. To become initiated and to become twice born. And that is the purpose of ISKCON. So therefore we see in the association of devotees. One can stay together despite the nature of Kali Yuga which is full of quarrel and fight. So it is possible to mature in devotional service only in the association of devotees. Therefore there is one more statement of Srila Prabhupada where Prabhupada says. That if one thinks that one can advance in devotional service or Krishna consciousness. By practicing alone. One is living in hallucination. To think that I can advance by myself living alone. I don't need any association of devotees. That means hallucination. It's only imagination.

segments.key_quote: ISKCON is a hospital.
segments.summary: The speaker acknowledges that friction and disagreements are natural when living with others, even in ISKCON, and uses the analogy of ISKCON being a hospital for those who recognize their spiritual disease.
segments.transcript: It is possible only in living in association of devotees. But then when we live with some devotees. When we live or when we stay with different people. It is natural that there will be some kind of friction. Some kind of disagreement. Some kind of you know fault from one person to other person. And there can be kind of disturbance between each other. So it is common. Even in the society of so called devotees. Even within ISKCON. It happened. Once one devotee came to Srila Prabhupada. And told Prabhupada that I want to leave this movement. I want to leave the association of devotees. So Prabhupada was very surprised. He was very distressed. He asked why? What happened? Why do you want to leave? So he said. This devotee. He said this to me. That devotee he is so harsh. So cruel. This devotee she is so mean. How can devotees behave like this? That's why I don't want to stay with them. Then Srila Prabhupada said. Who is devotee in ISKCON now? Only one devotee is there me. All of you have just shaven up. Wearing robes. Wearing tilak, kanti mala. And acting like devotees. So actually you are trying to be devotees. So you are not actually devotees. You are trying to be devotees. And therefore when we are practicing devotees. When we are sadhakas. It is natural that we are not perfect. We are all patients. ISKCON is a hospital.

segments.key_quote: Those who don't come to ISKCON, they don't know that they are deceased.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the hospital analogy, explaining that those who come to ISKCON are aware of their spiritual disease and are seeking treatment, and that devotional service makes the material world appear full of pleasure.
segments.transcript: The difference between those who come to ISKCON and those who don't come to ISKCON is They don't know that they are deceased. Those who don't come. Those who are coming regularly. And practicing everything. They know we have got the disease. So we are taking treatment from the doctor. And then Those who are little seriously infected. They will get admitted also. Like we are all admitted. Full time. Even more means intensive care. ICU. So actually we are all practitioners. People make mistake generally. When they see devotees, kanti mala, tilak. This thing they think that Oh he is sadhu. He is perfect. Sadhu bhushana. Sadhu means reservoir of all good qualities. It is true. It should be like that. But We are not pure. We are practicing. We are becoming pure. So therefore Prabhupada writes further in one more Srimad Bhagavatam purport about this. In the same context of Dhruva Maharaj's Leela Prabhupada says. Anyamadi philosopher may question us. You may be very happy in the association of devotees but what is your plan for crossing the ocean of material existence? Dhruva Maharaj's answer is that it is not very difficult. He clearly says that this ocean can be crossed very easily if one simply becomes mad to hear the glories of the lord. For anyone who consistently engages in hearing the topics of the lord from Srimad Bhagavad Gita, Bhagavatam and Chaitanya Charita Amrita and who is actually addicted to this process just as one becomes addicted to intoxicants it is very easy to cross the nescience of material existence. The ocean of material nescience is compared to a blazing fire. Samsara Dhabanala. But to a devotee this blazing fire is insignificant because he is completely absorbed in devotional service. Although the material world is blazing fire, to a devotee it appears full of pleasure. Vishwampurna Sukhayate.

segments.key_quote: By devotional service one is elevated to transcendental planet Goloka and Dhavan and also there, there is only devotional service.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that devotional service is the same in both the material and spiritual worlds, using the analogy of an unripe and ripe mango to illustrate the difference in relishability.
segments.transcript: So the purport of this statement by Dhruva Maharaj is that devotional service in the association of devotees is the cause of the development of further devotional service. By devotional service one is elevated to transcendental planet Goloka and Dhavan and also there, there is only devotional service. So for the devotee both in the material and spiritual world is the same. There also devotional service, here also devotional service. Devotional service does not change but the devotee changes, the devotee improves. Prabhupada gives wonderful example here in the purport. The example of mango can be given here. If one gets an unripe mango, it is still a mango. And when it is ripe it remains the same mango. But it has become more tasteful and relishable. When the mango becomes ripe it will be sweet, delicious, tasteful, relishable. Similarly, there is devotional service performed according to the directions of the spiritual master and injunctions and regulative principles of Shastra. That is Vaidhi Bhakti or Sadhana Bhakti. And there is devotional service in the spiritual world rendered directly in association with the Supreme Personality of Godhead. But they are both the same. There is no change. The difference is that one stage is unripe the other stage is ripe and more relishable.

segments.key_quote: Therefore, it is possible to mature in devotional service only in the association of devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of devotee association for maturing in devotional service, comparing devotees to unripe mangoes that may taste sour but can grow together in ISKCON.
segments.transcript: Therefore, it is possible to mature in devotional service only in the association of devotees. It is said that only in the association of devotees one can understand the importance of the character and pastimes of the Supreme Personality of Godhead or his devotees. So, therefore we are all unripe mangoes. So, we are all devotees but not pure devotees. We are in the process of becoming pure devotees. As long as we are following the instructions of the spiritual master, following the rules and regulations and trying to advance then we are in the path to become ripened. So, this is important. So, while we are in the path of becoming pure devotees there will be in the unripe stage there will be if you pluck an unripe stage if you taste an unripe mango what will happen? It will appear sour. Therefore, our relationships among devotees sometimes may appear sour. You are trying to bite an unripe mango. So, it will be sour. So, therefore we have to be careful and that is also one of the reason why Srila Prabhupada created ISKCON so that even unripe stage even the devotees in unripe stage, mangoes in unripe stage also can differentiate together

segments.key_quote: If you have committed some mistake you have to first repent realize I have made a mistake repent it repent for it
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the formula of RPP (Repent, Pray, Plan) as a framework for dealing with mistakes, emphasizing the importance of repentance, prayer for strength, and planning to avoid repeating the mistake.
segments.transcript: RPP RPP means what repent pray and plan repent pray and plan if you have committed some mistake you have to first repent realize I have made a mistake repent it repent for it if you have made a mistake to somebody please apologize and say repentance and then pray to the Lord pray to that devotee that I have made a mistake I am sorry pray to the Lord pray to spiritual master ask them for power to overcome this shortcoming or mistake so that I will not repeat this again pray and then plan not that simply oh sorry and then repent and then pray and you know next time again ok next time again I will repent again I will pray what is that no plan how I will not do it again in the outside world when some goof up happens some mess up happens especially in some event or some this thing some project or anything all of you who are in corporate world you might be knowing they will do something called RCA root cause analysis why it happened they will go and check and then root cause analysis and they will try to correct so for devotees instead of RCA what we do RPP repent pray and plan first we will repent oh I did like this I should not I will pray to the Lord so that I will not repeat like this again please give me power to overcome this shortcoming and I will plan how I will not do so what are the what caused me to do this how I should avoid this what I can do that plan you should make and then ideally we have to note down this RPP we have to if you write down once Prabhupada said to remember means to remember to note down if you note down then it will register oh repented prayed and planned what is the plan at least you have to write so that next time you will not repeat

segments.key_quote: Always in our dealings we think of giving hundred percent from our side in relationship and expect zero percent from the other side
